ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Functions to allow you to easily pass command-line arguments into R, and functions to aid in submitting your R code in parallel on a cluster and joining the results afterward (e.g. multiple parameter values for simulations running in parallel, splitting up a permutation test in parallel, etc.). See `parseCommandArgs(...)' for the main example of how to use this package.

Functions to allow you to easily pass command-line arguments into R, and functions to aid in submitting your R code in parallel on a cluster and joining the results afterward (e.g. multiple parameter values for simulations running in parallel, splitting up a permutation test in parallel, etc.). See `parseCommandArgs(...)' for the main example of how to use this package.

name: r-batch
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.1-5' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-batch
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/batch_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/batch/batch_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 986beeb34d6f27f889034a8c25bd142e811e29ff7b46321e66829428e676af71

build:
  number: 6
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('batch')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('batch')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://sites.google.com/site/thomashoffmannproject/
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Functions to allow you to easily pass command-line arguments into R, and functions
    to aid in submitting your R code in parallel on a cluster and joining the results
    afterward (e.g. multiple parameter values for simulations running in parallel, splitting
    up a permutation test in parallel, etc.). See `parseCommandArgs(...)' for the main
    example of how to use this package.
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: batch
# Version: 1.1-5
# Date: 2018-04-16
# Title: Batching Routines in Parallel and Passing Command-Line Arguments to R
# Author: Thomas Hoffmann <tjhoffm@gmail.com>
# Maintainer: Thomas Hoffmann <tjhoffm@gmail.com>
# Description: Functions to allow you to easily pass command-line arguments into R, and functions to aid in submitting your R code in parallel on a cluster and joining the results afterward (e.g. multiple parameter values for simulations running in parallel, splitting up a permutation test in parallel, etc.). See `parseCommandArgs(...)' for the main example of how to use this package.
# Suggests: parallel
# Depends: R (>= 2.14)
# License: GPL
# URL: http://sites.google.com/site/thomashoffmannproject/
# LazyLoad: true
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2018-04-16 21:07:26 UTC; tom
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2018-04-16 21:44:03 UTC
